contentrichtext.text: :'''''Phraortes''' was also an usurper to the throne of [[Darius the Great]].'' '''Phraortes''' (from {{lang-peo|'''𐎳𐎼𐎺𐎼𐎫𐎡𐏁'''}}, ''Fravartiš'',<ref>{{cite book|last=Akbarzadeh|first=D.|coauthors=A. Yahyanezhad|title=The Behistun Inscriptions (Old Persian Texts)|publisher=Khaneye-Farhikhtagan-e Honarhaye Sonati|year=2006|language=Persian|isbn=964-8499-05-5|pages=87}}</ref><ref name="kent-p406">{{cite book|last=Kent|first=Ronald Grubb|others=translated into Persian by S. Oryan|title=Old Persian: Grammar, Text, Glossary|isbn=964-421-045-X|year=1384 [[Iranian calendar|AP]]|language=Persian|pages=406}}</ref> or ''Frâda'' via [[Ancient Greek]] '''''Φραόρτης'''''; c. 665 - 633 BC), son of [[Diyako]], was the second king of the [[Median Empire]]. Like his father [[Deioces]], Phraortes started wars against [[Assyria]], but was defeated and killed by [[Ashurbanipal]], the king of [[Neo-Assyria]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== * ''[[:fr:Référence:Nos ancêtres de l'Antiquité (Christian Settipani)|Nos ancêtres de l'Antiquité]]'' (1991), [[Christian Settipani]], p. 152 ==External links== {{Portal|Ancient Near East}} * [http://www.livius.org/phr-phz/phraortes/phraortes.htm Phraortes @livius.org] {{S-start}} {{S-hou|||665 BC||633 BC}} {{S-reg}} {{S-bef|before=[[Deioces]]}} {{S-ttl|title=King of Media|years=665 BC-633 BC}} {{S-aft|after=[[Madius]]}} {{S-end}} {{Median and Achaemenid kings}} {{Median topics}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Phraortes | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:633 BC deaths]] [[Category:Median kings]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]] [[Category:660s BC births]] {{ANE-bio-stub}} {{Link FA|fa}}
